cameo_code.description: CAMEO code to describe the type of event in the ICEWS dataset
cameo_code.name: cameo_code

answer_option.description: An answer option for an IFP question
answer_option.name: answer_option

item.description: Used primarily to specify the item being priced in a Price event
item.name: item

actor__bokoharam_title.description: Title for Bokoharam actors, this field is created to filter out black lines in the input data to get an accurate number of deaths by Bokoharam
actor__bokoharam_title.name: actor__bokoharam_title

creation_date.description: The date when something was created.
creation_date.name: creation_date

actor.description: The person or organization that caused and event
actor.name: actor

victim.description: The entities affected by an event, they can be people, organizations, facilities, pretty much anything that suffers the consequences of an event.
victim.name: victim

measure.description: The link from a Measurement to a Measure, used to connect the points in a time series to the time series object. Not meant to be shown to end-users.
measure.name: measure

modality.description: Modifies the type of an object, such as the type of an event. Use it to specify things such as an event being desired or planned.
modality.name: modality

size.description: The size of something, applies in many contexts; the number of elements in a group or set; a default way to measure an object. In some cases it may be necessary to use more specific fields, but if the object has a primary way of being sized, store the value in this field.
size.name: size

city.description: Cities in geonames. NEVER assign values to this field in an extractor as DIG uses it internally to store the results of its entity resolution algorithm.
city.name: city

unit_of_measure.description: The unit of measure of some item
unit_of_measure.name: unit_of_measure

stock_ticker.description: Stock tickers mentioned in the page
stock_ticker.name: stock_ticker

interest_rate.description: short or long term interest rates
interest_rate.name: interest_rate

destination.description: The destination of a displacement event, e.g., movement of things or people. The value should be a string, such as the name of a country.
destination.name: destination

damage.description: The damage caused by an event. The victim refers to who was affected, and the damage refers to what was a affected. If someone destroys my house, I am the victim, and the damage is the house is the damage
damage.name: damage

label.description: A short text used to refer to an entity, e.g., the name of a person. An object can have many labels. It is fine to use one of the labels as the title.
label.name: label

dummy_acled_types.description: Field is here to force DIG to include the dict in the config
dummy_acled_types.name: dummy_acled_types

state.description: USA and Canada states as well as provinces in other countries
state.name: state

location.description: A generic mention of a location, can include address, city, state, country or any subset of this information. DIG will attempt to parse this field and extract useful city, state and country values from it. When you have a messy location text, put it here.
location.name: location

event_date.description: The date when an event happened. In case both start and end are known, use event_date for the start.
event_date.name: event_date

type.description: The type of an object in the KG. Include in type any string that can be used to identify a set of objects. Typically, objects will have many types as they can be placed in many different sets.
type.name: type

states_usa_codes.description: USA state codes mentioned in the page
states_usa_codes.name: states_usa_codes

website.description: The website that published the information
website.name: website

month_year_mentioned_in_question.description: Stores month/year mentions in a question, to be interpreted as a duration
month_year_mentioned_in_question.name: month_year_mentioned_in_question

description.description: A detailed description of an object, typically much longer than the title
description.name: description

identifier.description: An identifier for an object; there can be many identifiers
identifier.name: identifier

event_date_end.description: The date when an event ended
event_date_end.name: event_date_end

phone.description: Phone numbers mentioned in the page
phone.name: phone

dummy_privacyrights_types.description: Field is here to force DIG to include the dict in the config
dummy_privacyrights_types.name: dummy_privacyrights_types

positive_cases.description: Number of positive cases for an event(diseases)
positive_cases.name: positive_cases

city_name.description: City names mentioned in the page. When you have a value that contains a city name, but is not a city name, put it in the location field, and DIG will extract the city name from it.
city_name.name: city_name

stadium.description: The stadium name of the team
stadium.name: stadium

publication_date.description: The date when something was published
publication_date.name: publication_date

nationality.description: The nationality of a group, organization, facility, etc. Best to list it as a country, i.e., Colombia rather than Colombian
nationality.name: nationality

resolution_date.description: The date when a situation gets resolved
resolution_date.name: resolution_date

currrency.description: Specifies the currency for a price, e.g., usd. Use the standard notation in lower case.
currrency.name: currrency

price_usd.description: the price of something in US dollars
price_usd.name: price_usd

region.description: Regions of the world, e.g., middle east
region.name: region

value.description: Used to hold the value of a Measurement (point in a time series), when this value is a number. When the value is not a number, it is stored as a label. The scope of this field may be extended to cover other situations when we need to store numbers.
value.name: value

capacity.description: The number of people that the stadium can hold
capacity.name: capacity

email.description: Email addresses mentioned in the page
email.name: email
